do an ls of a github repo

Source: R/github_utils.R
ls_github.Rd

Specify repo, path, and github reference (master, sha, etc.) and get back an ls of that directory, including download links.

ls_github(repository, path = "", ref = "master")

Arguments

repository

character(1) formatted as 'user/repo_name' from Github
path

character(1) The path in the repo to ls on
ref

character(1) The github reference (tag, sha, branch) to run the ls on. Default is master.

Value

A tibble with columns including:

  • name

  • path

  • size

  • download_url

  • type (file or dir)

Examples

ls_github('TheEconomist/covid-19-excess-deaths-tracker',
          'output-data/excess-deaths')

#> # A tibble: 25 x 10
#>    name  path  sha     size url   html_url git_url download_url type 
#>    <chr> <chr> <chr>  <int> <chr> <chr>    <chr>   <chr>        <chr>
#>  1 all_… outp… 254d… 6.10e4 http… https:/… https:… https://raw… file 
#>  2 all_… outp… b063… 1.09e6 http… https:/… https:… https://raw… file 
#>  3 aust… outp… faf7… 7.93e3 http… https:/… https:… https://raw… file 
#>  4 belg… outp… fa74… 7.59e3 http… https:/… https:… https://raw… file 
#>  5 braz… outp… b48c… 7.14e3 http… https:/… https:… https://raw… file 
#>  6 brit… outp… ecd0… 1.12e5 http… https:/… https:… https://raw… file 
#>  7 chil… outp… ad72… 1.24e5 http… https:/… https:… https://raw… file 
#>  8 denm… outp… 25dc… 7.72e3 http… https:/… https:… https://raw… file 
#>  9 ecua… outp… 7966… 5.45e4 http… https:/… https:… https://raw… file 
#> 10 fran… outp… decf… 1.12e5 http… https:/… https:… https://raw… file 
#> # … with 15 more rows, and 3 more variables: `_links`$self <chr>, $git <chr>,
#> #   $html <chr>
